channel.title: Series on Log4j Exploitability Index
channel.description: Recent content in Series on Log4j Exploitability Index

item.title: Amazon Redshift
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL Amazon Redshift clusters have been automatically updated to mitigate the issues identified in CVE-2021-44228 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-16 15:34:24 NCSC-NL Updated vendorPatchExists. Updated community link source. Updated community note.

item.title: Amazon S3
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL All S3 systems are patched Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-14 15:24:48 NCSC-NL Updated vendorPatchExists. Updated community link source. Updated community note.

item.title: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL Systems that serve customer traffic are patched against the Log4j2 issue. Working to apply the patch to sub-systems that operate separately from SNS’s systems that serve customer traffic. Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-16 15:34:24 NCSC-NL Updated vendorPatchExists.

item.title: Amazon WorkSpaces/AppStream 2.0
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://aws.amazon.com/security/security-bulletins/AWS-2021-006/ Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL Not affected by CVE-2021-44228 with default configurations. WorkDocs Sync client versions 1.2.895.1 and older within Windows WorkSpaces, which contain the Log4j component, are vulnerable; For update instruction, see source for more info Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-16 15:34:24 NCSC-NL Updated vendorPatchExists.
